dt: {bc}to promote the growth or development of {bc}{sx|rouse||}, {sx|incite||}

pt: {sc}incite{/sc} {sc}instigate{/sc} {sc}abet{/sc} {sc}foment{/sc} mean to spur to action. {sc}incite{/sc} stresses a stirring up and urging on, and may or may not imply initiating.
{sc}instigate{/sc} definitely implies responsibility for initiating another's action and often connotes underhandedness or evil intention.

et: Middle English, to apply a warm substance to, from Late Latin {it}fomentare{/it}, from Latin {it}fomentum{/it} compress, from {it}fovēre{/it} to heat, soothe; akin to Lithuanian {it}degti{/it} to burn, Sanskrit {it}dahati{/it} it burns
shortdef: to promote the growth or development of : rouse, incite
